website_summaries.verdict: A highly-rated reinterpretation of the ancient Tao Te Ching as applied to parenting for daily doses of calm and wisdom.
pros: Loved by parents to keep themselves grounded during the tumult of child rearing
Good advice for parents who tend to “over parent.” Topics broken down into short, digestible excerpts, ideal for busy parents
Can be flipped through to random lessons to read and re-read
Some readers are emotionally moved by the writing and wisdom
cons: More inspirational than substantial – doesn't give any examples or specific guidance

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: Every parent needs this book. I was raised by selfish, emotionally damaged parents. When I had kids I was determined not to repeat the unhealthy patterns I was raised with. This book has helped me to be the kind of parent I always have wanted to be. It gave me a blueprint on how an older soul should guide a younger soul. My husband and I read an excerpt everyday and we have become better humans and parents because of it.
customer_reviews.author: Helenius Monk

customer_reviews.title: Grounds me and my parenting
customer_reviews.text: This book is incredible. Short daily messages to hold as a meditation and guidance. The philosophy of the Tao delivered as a guide for parents is genius, and I'd take more of this. But this book with it's easily digestible readings has calmed me down when I get frazzled about doing too much or not doing enough as a parent. This immediately helps me reframe my thinking and get back to my intention of being a parent of love and patience. I treasure this book.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: A good cup of coffee and an hour of alone time ...
customer_reviews.text: I return to this book again and again to ground me and guide me as a parent. A good cup of coffee and an hour of alone time with this book is all I need to feel like "I can do this." I gift this book to parents that are struggling and also to first-time parents as a shower/Mother blessing gift. I have read it cover to cover several times, as well as picking it up for a few pages of inspiration here and there. This book is a must-have in my arsenal of self and childcare books.
customer_reviews.author: Sara G

customer_reviews.title: Meaningful little lessons!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect book for parents who really believe in simplicity parenting, attached parenting and those who seek calm and clarity in the midst of sometimes unavoidable hectic times with children. I just love the way that there is always a core, essential, nurturing topic to explore but, in short exerts....keeping in mind that sometimes parents may only have a couple of minutes at a time to really focus. This book really brings meaningful little lessons to focus on each day!
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Raise Your Children to Become Productive Adults
customer_reviews.text: Perfect advice for parents who tend to over parent and need help learning to let go. My husband and I both read this when our oldest left for college and we needed it. Refreshing and useful tips. Learn to let them become adults or they will never mature. Advice well taken. Melissa Sugar @ <a href="[...] [...]
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, helpful, and easy to read.
customer_reviews.text: As a newbie to Taoism I was immediately interested in this book. It was a quick read and I took many nuggets of helpfulness as I navigate parenthood. It's a gentle and supporting read for parents. I look forward to sharing it with friends and I'm happy to implement the lessons. Things like "Don't presume their readiness to listen. Even when they listen, they see with their own eyes."
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: The best boom in parenting EVER!!
customer_reviews.text: This book has opened my eyes to parenting and I’m at the end of my childbearing ages. I wish I would have found this book when my twins were babies not 18 and my oldest 19. I give this to every expectant mother I know!!!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: A must have for any engaged parent.
customer_reviews.text: Never stop learning. Especially when it comes to your kid. I often find myself coming back to the teachings of this book when parenthood takes its toll on your sense of reason. Great lessons for life and wonderful perspective on parenting.
customer_reviews.author: wb

customer_reviews.title: It really is wonderful. Everyone who sees it at our house and ...
customer_reviews.text: This book was given to us when we were expecting our first child. We now give it to other expectant parents. It really is wonderful. Everyone who sees it at our house and flips through it comments on how good it is too. Short enough to satisfy even the busiest parent, but with deep calming wisdom on each page.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book!!
customer_reviews.text: I have never done a review despite purchasing many things and books on Amazon but after reading this book I felt compelled to review it. This book gives insight into a way of parenting that is greatly needed in our complex world. This is not a book to be skimmed through but requires thoughtful reflection. I would recommend this book to all parents.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime

customer_reviews.title: ... this for myself and have now ordered for friends--I love it. Makes me smile
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for myself and have now ordered for friends--I love it. Makes me smile, makes me tear up, makes me think about what it is I TRULY need to be doing to continue to become a better parent. You can read one page over and over and just sit up in bed and think about it. Very wise, old advice that is relevant to today's life.

customer_reviews.text: I can't drink coffee for health reasons, and I don't rarely drink alcohol. My vice as a single parent? This book. I flip to a random page, usually when I'm wearing one kid while another is hanging from the ceiling, so to speak. It's a beautiful reminder to step back and breathe.
customer_reviews.author: L. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Amazing perspective for parents
customer_reviews.text: Whenever I'm unsure or frustrated or upset with my son, I turn to this book flip to a random page and always find the right guidance to get me back in focus on how to be there for my son, be a good parent, not to beat myself up so much and love my son for who he is, the actions he takes and appreciate his feelings. I'm grateful for being introduced to this book.

It's a book that lasts for the entire lifetime of parenting, from infancy through adulthood. It's a beautiful little book full of gems.

A book that I get something out of every time I glance at a page.

A beautiful gift for any serious new parent.

customer_reviews.title: Dependable author, great book
customer_reviews.text: William Martin is the best at adapting the Tao te Ching to modern life and age appropriate references. I now have younger children in my Tai Chi class and will read from this to engage them. Love the Sage's Tao te Ching which I've used for years to begin class.
customer_reviews.author: C.J. Prince

customer_reviews.title: Best parenting book ever.
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. It's full of gems for becoming centered as a parent, against the grain of 'traditional' parenting wisdom about how to control, coerce, or otherwise influence our kids. The heart of its wisdom is to step back and let our children be who they are. It's just beautiful, and I give it as gifts to other parents whenever I can.
customer_reviews.author: J. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: in the most beautiful way, of everything we need to be in ...
customer_reviews.text: This book should be every parent's bible. This book reminds us, in the most beautiful way, of everything we need to be in this world. I'm infinitely grateful for this book.

customer_reviews.title: helpful and inspiring
customer_reviews.text: I read this book over and over again, raised Catholic and not religious. I find this book easy to read and very practical. I opened it tonight to ease my mind about our son who has many challenges. I would do anything to make his life better or easier- this book has given me done if those tools. Truly Grateful! Good luck to anyone dealing answers with a difficult child- this book and a good Therapist may help you.;)

customer_reviews.text: I love this book and have given it as a gift to nephews and young friends. There is such an amazing message of kindness and care that is applicable not only to how one relates to your children, but also to oneself and anyone around you. I often read one or two pages in the morning to help frame my day. The wisdom is timeless.

customer_reviews.text: The Parent's Tao Te Ching is thought provoking and realistic. It is simple wisdom and truth for all people of all ages with or without children. It provides reminders of how to respect ourselves and each other. This book actually gives simpleexamples of what works and what does not; how best to respond. I have given and will continue to gift this book to people I love.

This would make a great gift for parents (or yourself) with a child of any age. Enjoy!

customer_reviews.title: Simply Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: William Martin has crafted an inspiring little book of wisdom for parents based upon and reflective of the Tao Te Ching attributed to the Chinese sage Lao Tzu some 2,500 years ago. The book is divided into 81 "chapters," with each chapter (many just a single page) reading like a short poem in two parts: First an observation, then an instruction. Topics range from "Relax Your Grip" and "No Need for Threats" to "Be a Model of Honesty" and "Each Day is a Dance." The text is simple, beautiful, and concise, combining affirmative free verse with a positive call to action that is sure to resonate with all belief systems and parenting philosophies rooted in love.
customer_reviews.author: Socratic Parent

customer_reviews.title: Only read the first few pages -- I already love it. I read the Tao Te Ching many ...
customer_reviews.text: Only read the first few pages -- I already love it. I read the Tao Te Ching many years ago, and this book (so far) captures that essence, but also stands on its own.

customer_reviews.title: I think this book had the best parenting advice that I have heard or seen in ...
customer_reviews.text: I think this book had the best parenting advice that I have heard or seen in many years. It was both comforting and liberating, but most of all it was thought-provoking. I learned that many times I need to work on my own pre-conceived notions before addressing certain behavioral issues with my children. In fact, I have already started applying the concepts taught in this book and already see a difference in myself and in my son. I would recommend this to anyone wishing to improve their parenting style and relationship with their children.

customer_reviews.title: Parent's Tao Te Ching
customer_reviews.text: Lovely book that I had sent to my daughter, a busy Mom who works in Manhattan, gets home at 7 to care for her 8 year old daughter!
customer_reviews.author: Marcelle J. Walsh

product_meta.title: The Parent's Tao Te Ching: Ancient Advice for Modern Parents
